name: Associate 1-3, Valuation, M&A & Financing, Deal Advisory
description:
What we do

As a member firm of one of the world's leading professional services organizations, KPMG in Kazakhstan brings clients technical skills, solid practical experience and wide industry and sector knowledge which provide them with an efficient edge over their competitors. Our goal is to help our clients not only compete, but become marketplace leaders.

Responsibilities

Participation in the following assignments:

  • Taking part in different stages of Advisory projects for Real Estate branch (valuation, feasibility studies, development consulting, strategy development), Business Valuation projects, tangible assets valuations (fixed assets) for various purposes;
  • Dealing with management and personnel of a client and a target company (also during site visits);
  • Carrying out financial analysis of company's historic results and projections, conducting industry research;
  • Preparing of various types of financial models (from express models to complex flexible financial models);
  • Conducting industry research and market analysis;
  • Report writing and checking;
  • Preparation of client deliverables, reports, proposals, contracts and other project-related documentation as well as marketing materials;
  • Supervising work of junior staff, coaching and mentoring;
  • Preparation and supervision of preparation of marketing and presentation materials.

To fill the role a candidate is expected to meet the following requirements:

  • Higher education, desirably in finance/economics or technical (preferable Engineer if Fixed Assets oriented);
  • At least 3 - 5 years of relevant experience in a Bank / Private Equity / internal Corporate Finance Department / BIG4 / Valuation consulting firm or real estate companies and/or 3 years of relevant experience in an Industry (oil & gas, Metals and mining, industrial plant);
  • Knowledge of valuation methodology and techniques: DCF, different approaches to valuation;
  • Knowledge of financial accounting, good understanding of IFRS, US GAAP, RAP;
  • IT skills: advanced MS Excel, Word, Power Point user;
  • Strong analytical skills: numeracy, ability to structure large amounts of data, advanced research skills;
  • Excellent writing and presentation skills;
  • Fast learner, team player with strong communication skills;
  • Ready for travelling;
  • CFA, ASA, ACCA or DipIFR certification is a plus;
  • Fluent English and Russian.

The role enables to:

  • Enjoy accelerated career development with rapidly growing firm;
  • Work and grow in a people driven organization;
  • Deal with leading clients in complex and challenging assignments;
  • Benefit from a strong learning and development culture;
  • Experience the excitement of contributing to a dynamic and constantly changing environment;
  • Have an opportunity to work on a wide range of Deal Advisory engagements in an extremely dynamic and rapidly developing market environment.
